page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There were stations at Shandwick, Balintore,Hilton and Skaravack.With the introduction of the Aluminium Smelter in Invergordon and the dumping of waste from it in the Moray Firth the number of fish caught gradually began to drop noiticeably.With the introduction of the Fabrication yard at Nigg it became very difficult for employers to compete with wages offered at Nigg.And those who had worked as fishermen drifted to Nigg to work as welders and other work in the yard.On the other hand the smiddy at Balmuchy was changing slowly from a blacksmith to an agricultural engineers. With the demand for steel coming from the smelter and Nigg, business boomed & W.G Mackays started in steel fabrication.Within five-six years it went from a one man business to a firm
